titles.title: A bill to authorize the Secretary of the Interior to provide for the development and operation of a visitor and environmental education center in the Pinelands National Reserve, in the State of New Jersey.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Referred to Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources requested executive comment from Interior Department, OMB.
Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks. Hearings held.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources received executive comment from Interior Department. Unfavorable.

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Johnston without amendment. With written report No. 100-244.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 473.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.subcommittee: Public Lands, National Parks and Forests
committee.name: Senate Energy and Natural Resources

bill.summary: 9/20/1988--Passed House amended. (Measure passed House, amended) Amends the National Parks and Recreation Act of 1978 to direct the Secretary of the Interior, within nine months after enactment of this Act, to study and recommend initiatives to provide an educational and interpretive program for the Pinelands National Reserve, New Jersey, through the improvement of existing facilities and programs in the Reserve. Directs the Secretary to study New Jersey's Pinelands Development Credit Bank, Pinelands Development Credit System, and Pinelands Municipal Council and submit to the Congress, within nine months after enactment of this Act, recommendations for improvements in the operation of such programs and council. Provides Federal funds for 50 percent of the cost for land acquisitions under this Act. Authorizes appropriations.
